result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:03 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Harold L. Faulkner in court, in custody with Attorney Walter W Stern III in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Bond motion filed by Attorney Stern. Arguments heard. For reasons set forth on the record the Court denies the bond motion. Attorney Stern is also requesting an adjournment of the final pretrial set for 10/14/22 as he was just retained and needs additional time to review all the discovery. The State does not object. Court approves the request to adjourn.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Atty Stern unavailable for separate MH on 9/20/22. Motion to Modify Bond set on with FPT on 10/14/22 @ 11am.

02:10 PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Harold L. Faulkner, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Attorney Celebre is requesting additional time to review all the video discovery and to discuss resolution. The State does not object. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of assignment of judge returned. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward.

11:56 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Harold L. Faulkner, appeared  in custody with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Celebre advises the Court that he just received an offer from the State and is requesting an adjournment so he may discuss it with the DE. The State does not object. Court adjourns. Court takes no action on the DE's pro se bond motion sent to the Court.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Harold L. Faulkner in court, in custody.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE is pro se today after not being eligible for SPD or Advocate counsel.    ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; no cross-examination. . ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial.   Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:57 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.   Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am. Bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry).
